title: Drawing, 1780–90
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, on paper
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Giovanni Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Chair in three-quarter view, with a tall rectangular back, square seat, short straight arms, and gently tapering legs on ball feet. The only ornamentation is the backward C-curves on the arms, entablature-like vertical striations on the seat, and balls at the end of the legs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1780–90.
1780–90. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-432.
